Posts.Content: I was so hoping that it would have been benign. I does seem that things are moving quite rapidly for you, but maybe that is a good thing. Less time to worry and more time devoted to being proactive and fighting the beast. All my love, Surf
Posts.Title: Monday's Biopsy Results

Posts.Content: How did your sister do with her port? I'd be interested to know because my port is in my breast also. Love Surf
Posts.Title: 1 down 3 to go BC Sucks!

Posts.Content: Yikes, what happened after you injured your ribs? Did they treat you  at the mamography center or send you to the ER?  Who is responsible for paying for your care ? I hope you are doing well and am happy that you are still NED. Love Surf
Posts.Title: Yea 5year mammmo

Posts.Content: Vicki Sam i hope you have the best day ever!!!  Love Surf
Posts.Title: Today is VickiSam's Birthday!!

Posts.Content: Hi, I hope you are feeling better today. I had horrible nausea throughout treatment, it was so bad that I couldn't even make it back from the treatment center without throwing up. My onc. told me to take the meds before I even felt sick. It didn't work for me but I know others who took their meds prior to feeling sick had little or no nausea. The only thing that worked for me was the Sancusco patch, which you wear on your upper arm and the medicine is dispersed transdermaly. It was a Godsend for me. Love Surf
Posts.Title: Nausea!!!! Help

Posts.Content: I'm on board. I hope all goes well for you today. Love Surf
Posts.Title: Pink Bus Please

Posts.Content: Mamma G, I am so glad that the procedure was a breeze for you. I hope it does the trick. Love Surf
Posts.Title: Cyberknife was a BREEZE!!

Posts.Content: Pat, I know that you feel down and that is alright. I used to feel that I always had to stay positive and not complain and I would feel guilty if I didn't quite feel up to doing my normal activities i.e cooking for my family, taking my children to school, attending their sporting events. I have been on chemo since March 4, 2009 and will end chemo on 9-2-2009(God willing). I finally came to the point of breaking and told my family and friends that I have a right to feel depressed and and I have a right to put my self first for once in my life. I agree with Mimi send your nieces a facebook message. I have a niece who I text often it seems that telephone conversations are a thing of the past. Also do you belong to a church or have a service group like the Boy Scouts in your area. Perhaps they could help with the maintenance of your home. I wish you lived close to me as my oldest son (15 years) is required to do service hours for our church. I know that some of his friends that are scouts are often in need of projects for their Eagle Scout. Just a thought. Take good care of your self. Love Surf
Posts.Title: Pity Party

Posts.Content: Hi Sparkle1 I too have a new primary  it's in my right breast. I haven't had surgery yet, and I just was told that my surgery date was moved to a week later.  I feel like you ;my cancer was 8 years ago and I feel much older also .I'm so sorry that you have to go through it all over again. But I'm here and we can do it together along with all the wonderful members of this site. Love surf
Posts.Title: Back Again

Posts.Content: I also have a special place in my heart for Claudia. She has been so helpful to me especially when I was facing my surgery. I am sending positive thoughts and warm gentle hugs. Surf

Posts.Content: JoyD Are you in SoCal or NorCal? I live in California also and it is a glorious day here. I plan on watching my 10 year old play baseball wearing my Yankee hat and my "halo" underneath. I hope everyone has a great day and good luck on Wed. I don't have to go back for chemo until 5-6-09, and I plan on enjoying everything up until then. The type of chemo I'm on( AC ) really makes me sick . Surfer Mom

Posts.Title: ChenHeart update March 8, February 24 & 28

Posts.Content: Oh Claudia, I am sending you very positive thoughts and prayers. You have helped me and countless others with your strength, wisdom and your incredible ability to write the most profound and heartfelt comments.I am so bummed that you have to endure the misery again it just isn't right that someone so kind and generous has to battle the beast once more. If you need anything I am only 2 hours away in SoCal, my oncological surgeon is also a liver specailist so if you would like his name or to dicuss his credentials just P.M. me. Love you Surf.
Posts.Title: Just when I thought it was safe to go back in the water, I was bitten by Jaws! So to speak...

Posts.Content: Well it seems like I'm the lone southern californian, it looks like we have the whole state covered with everyone from Northern, Central and Southern CA..Yesterday my little leaguers Yankee team lost 7 to 2.My son struck out with bases loaded, so I had a sad little guy to deal with. Joy D, I am also in a clinical trial I am receiving my treatment at St.Joseph's Hospital in Orange, Ca.. My chemo program is 4 cycles AC every 21 days ( I only have one more to go !!!), taxol, herceptin(I'm her2+) once a week for 4 cycles with breaks every three weeks, a tablet called Lapatnib which I will take everyday up unitl surgery, surgery, rads and herceptin for a year. How are you with the AC? It makes me very sick.

Posts.Title: Just when I thought it was safe to go back in the water, I was bitten by Jaws! So to speak...

Posts.Content: My hair started to fall out in wisps about day 14 after my first chemo. I had long hair and I cut it short( kind of like Kate Gosslin's ; I had chemo in 2009) before my first infusion. When it started falling out in clumps I asked my husband to shave my head. For me the anxiety of loosing it was worse than it falling out. Once my head was shaved I felt strangely relieved. Do you have a cancer center near your home? I was able to get a free wig and I purchased some cute headcoverings in the center's gift shop. Also look into the Look Good Feel Better program by the ACS, it is really helpful. I know how hard this is for you and it is my hope that you can go through this process with peace. Love Surf
Posts.Title: need advice on hair loss preparation

Posts.Content: Hi Cherryblssm, I will keep you in my thoughts and prayers for Thursday. This board is filled with wise people who will give you some great advice throughout your whole treatment and beyond. I can only offer my experience with Chemo. On the day of my first treatment I can honestly say I had never felt so vulnerable in all of my life. It is a feeling that is hard to describe but in all honesty it was pretty awful. After the infusion I felt pretty good and almost relieved that it wasn't as bad as what I had conjured up in my head. Make sure that you hydrate, hydrate and hydrate some more. Don't be frightened when you see bright red urine ( it's just the lovely AC). Also make sure you take your medications before you feel sick, I didn't and learned the hardway.  I know it's hard but it is doable and if you need anything we are here to help. Love Surf
Posts.Title: 1st Chemo on Thursday

Posts.Content: You are in my thoughts and prayers. I hope that you will be able to rest and heal quickly. Love Surf
Posts.Title: Surgery is done

Posts.Content: My second chemo was much worse than the first, but it was my fault. I failed to take the anti-nausea drugs before the nausea actually happened. So just be sure to take your pills before you feel sick and try to keep something in your stomach. Also keep hydrated. I hope that you sail through your second infusion. I have five more taxol/herceptin treatments to go. Love Surf
Posts.Title: 2nd chemo treatment, wish me luck

Posts.Content: Trace, Thanks for the update.  I hope our dear Traci is doing fine and is in good spirits. Love Surf
Posts.Title: Update on TraciInLA

Posts.Content: I am so glad that you are doing better on the Taxol. I had  weekly 12 infusions of taxol with herceptin. I had my infusions on Wednesday and felt pretty good until about Friday eve at about 5:00 P.M. and then the exhaustion would hit. I would spend the weekend on the couch and then feel like my old self on Monday just enough time to feel good and then back in on Wednesday.  I tolerated the Taxol pretty well although I did have to have an anti nausea patch. I had a much easier time on Taxol than the AC. I do hope that you are still doing well and be sure to be kind to yourself and not over do it. Love Surf
Posts.Title: Taxol starts Tuesday, advice?

Posts.Content: Wosmith,  Although this is not my personal experience have you tried Ronald McDonald House? It was recommend to me when I was deciding if I was going to particpate in a clinic trail for radiation. It may be an option if  there is one close to the facility where she will be receiving treatment. This board is filled with members that may give you some additional information and ideas.  Love Surf
Posts.Title: Mom Has Metastic Breast Cancer Disease

Posts.Content: Hi everyone, I finished my final round of AC and now I have lost most of my eyelashes. I think this is worst than the hair loss. I look like an ailien, did I mention I longer have eyebrows? Like ohillys thick hair I had long full eyelashes .I miss them. When will they come back? Will they fall out with taxol? Any advice will be appreciated. Surf
Posts.Title: Eyelashes

Posts.Content: Hi Carol Thats just crazy, I agree with Double Whammy the woman who knocked you over is an awful person. A gang altercation at a celebration of Mormon culture? What is the world coming to?  I think it is so cool that you are going to do the zip line at the Olympic village at Park City.  I think I would be terrified of the height. Your spirit is amazing and inspiring.  Love Surf

Posts.Title: Happy Valentines Day( best romantic movie?)

Posts.Content: I just occured to me that I used to worry if I didn't take a certain pill I might get pregnant. Now I worry if I don't take Letrozole  the cancer may return. How times have changed!!! Lol, Loev Surf
Posts.Title: Letrozole observation

Posts.Content: Thanks for sharing this. Especially the quotes Isn't true that sometimes the simplest words can have such a profound meaning. Love Surf
Posts.Title: Off the Topic... I saw the Dalai Lama speak yesterday at USC

Posts.Content: Roseann I too am 5 years from the day I heard the news it was Feb. 9 for me.  I know how you feel. To me it seems like so long ago and then something will trigger it for me and it seems like just yesterday. I like your prospective of enjoying each and everyday. I think I kind of overdid the fun stuff this year in January I went to Disneyworld and I just got back from a 4 day trip to Oahu HI in which on Feb. 9th  I hiked Diamond Head and at the top I held out my five fingers in a salute to life. I then began to cry , I just don't know why it became so emotional to me but it did.  Love surf
Posts.Title: Five years ago today!

Posts.Content: Hi Doris, I agree with Suzanne, you must just feel terrible. I know you have the strength to continue but I also understand how hard  it is to try to go on when you feel so defeated. I had a horrible time on chemo, like you I could not keep anything down and the anti nausea drugs just didn't work. My nurse at the time suggested the Sancuso patch, what a lifesaver, it works transdermally so you don't have to swallow anything. It really helped me  after wearing the patch I didn't have any nausea. I hope that it can be an option for you. It really helped me. Love Surf
Posts.Title: Need what?
